segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far, balancing on his toes, and his sister is just waiting for him to hand her a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how risky this is—he could fall and hurt himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, but she’s completely unaware of what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids do this often when she’s not looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is just sitting there, open and tempting, and they can’t resist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should warn them, but I’m just an observer here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful, like she’s sure her brother will get her a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they don’t get caught, but I also hope they don’t get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
